page.title: 03The Old Coaching Inns,Calne.
page.content: In the 19th century there were 12 coaches a day going through Calne. Stage waggons carried goods and pasengers,pulled by 8 horses,going mainly from Oxford to London.Stage coaches came mostly from London and Bristol.They all changed horses in Calne. The Lansdowne <Strand> Hotel was once known as the Catherine Wheel.It dates back to 1582.It was the haunt of farmers and wool traders. The King's Arms has two old timetable boards outside advertising coach arrivals. The White Hart is on the London Road.In 1984 there was a re_enactment of the Bristol to London mail_coach run.They changed horses in Calne at the Lansdowne.The passengers were in period costume.
